perturbation.original_text: 2.1 The Appointment will begin on 27 January 2020 or such other date as the parties shall agree and when the Executive is not subject to any restrictions to prevent the commencement of his employment with the Company. There is no period of previous employment with the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 The Start Date will begin on 27 January 2020 or such other date as the parties shall agree and when the Employee is not subject to any restrictions to prevent the commencement of his work with the Firm. There is no period of previous work with the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Appointment' to 'Start Date' and 'Executive' to 'Employee' creates ambiguity about whether these terms refer to the same concept, especially if 'Firm' is used rather than 'Company'.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 The Company will pay the Executive a salary of £740,000 and a fixed benefits allowance of £30,000 per annum. The salary (and so far, as is reasonably possible) the benefits allowance will accrue from day to day and be payable in equal instalments in arrears on or around the 25th day of every month, less deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions and shall be inclusive of any fees receivable by the Executive as a director of any Group Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 The Corporation will provide the Employee compensation of £740,000 and a fixed benefits allotment of £30,000 per annum. The compensation (and so far, as is reasonably possible) the benefits allotment will accrue from day to day and be payable in equal instalments in arrears on or around the 25th day of every month, less deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions and shall be inclusive of any fees receivable by the Executive as a director of any Group Company.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Company' to 'Corporation', 'Executive' to 'Employee', 'salary' to 'compensation' and 'allowance' to 'allotment' introduces terminology misalignment, implying different roles or benefits. The change from allowance to allotment could have financial implications.

perturbation.original_text: 15.1 The Appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 12 months' notice in writing. 15.2 The Company may in its sole and absolute discretion (whether or not any notice of termination has been given under sub clause 15.1) terminate this Agreement at any time and with immediate effect by giving notice in writing to the Executive that the Company is exercising its rights pursuant to this clause 15. If the Company elects to terminate the Executive's employment in this way, it will make, within 30 days, either the first instalment (of equal monthly instalments) of a, or an entire, payment in lieu of notice (Payment in Lieu) equal to the basic salary, benefit allowance and any benefits, as at the Termination Date, which the Executive would have been entitled to receive under this Agreement during the notice period referred to at sub clause 15.1 (or, if notice has already been given, during the remainder of the notice period), less all relevant deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 The Contract may be discontinued by either side giving the other at least 12 months' notification in writing. 15.2 The Firm may in its sole and absolute discretion (whether or not any notice of discontinuance has been given under sub clause 15.1) end this Agreement at any time and with immediate effect by giving notice in writing to the Personnel that the Firm is exercising its rights pursuant to this clause 15. If the Company chooses to end the individual's employment in this way, it will make, within 30 days, either the first instalment (of equal monthly instalments) of a, or an entire, payment in lieu of notice (Payment in Lieu) equal to the basic salary, benefit allowance and any benefits, as at the Termination Date, which the Employee would have been entitled to receive under this Agreement during the notice period referred to at sub clause 15.1 (or, if notice has already been given, during the remainder of the notice period), less all relevant deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Appointment' to 'Contract', 'terminated' to 'discontinued', 'Company' to 'Firm', 'Executive' to 'Personnel' and 'end' in one part, causes confusion regarding the conditions under which the contract can be dissolved and who holds the authority to terminate. It is also not specific of who is an individual vs. the Personnel.
